headline.print_headline: Bill Keith, Musician Who Uncovered Banjo’s Melodic Potential, Dies at 75
headline.main: Bill Keith, Who Uncovered Banjo’s Melodic Potential, Dies at 75

snippet: Mr. Keith turned a largely percussive instrument into one with unforeseen melodic potential, bridging the traditional stylists of the mid-20th century and more freewheeling latter-day players.
abstract: Bill Keith, banjo player whose signature technique, known as Keith-style picking, transformed the banjo from a largely percussive instrument to one with melodic potential, dies at age 75.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Keith turned a largely percussive instrument into one with unforeseen melodic potential, bridging the traditional stylists of the mid-20th century and more freewheeling latter-day players.
